title: Talon's WR back to almost 55% in diamond
body: Thanks for the useless nerfs riot, how about giving him some real nerfs to his broken early game damage or 0 cost mobility?

If he used Tiamat on the wave he also loses a ton of kill pressure on you. It's virtually the time to blow him up even with minions up as his W early is a whopping 7+ sec cd.

You can also dodge or bait out the Talon, that's not even a valid argument. He's got a 575 max range, you outrange him massively so if you allowed him to get in Q range and didn't even bind/charm/stun him mid-leap where he is animation locked and then walked away from any follow up by him, that's your failing.

It's one thing to be caught out on the jungle by a Talon, but if you're dying to him in lane as Lux, Ahri, or Anivia, you are not playing a mage properly.

So Talon pretend to walk up to blow you up and but then he just sidestep your CC ability(or he just goes back without trying to dodge) and clear the wave with Tiamat combo. Then he goes to roam. Even if you do land the CC and chunk him half health, he clears the wave and goes to roam. Why? Cause you need to back off or Talon will blow you up.

If Talon walk up to pretend he is going to jump and blow you up, and you back off, he is going to go back to farm through Tiamat combo and leave.

He doesn't need to kill you at all. He can kill someone in bot lane or top lane, even the jungler instead. He can just Tiamat combo, pretend to gank a different lane or actually gank, and also clear vision while you need to deal with the wave, because he can zone you off it.

Maybe it is just less lane interaction with Tiamat(and not no lane interaction), but giving an assassin to be able to clear the wave that fast isn't that healthy. But the most interactions the opposing laner can get out of it is 1 combo and some poke if Talon isn't good.

Second, if you chunk half of Talon's health and he goes roaming, he dies to anyone who's not a vegetable because any Lee Sin or Xin Zhao or even bot lane can kill a half health talon in less time than it takes him to throw a W Q combo.

He isn't going to ever blow a control mage up if the control mage knows what they're doing or gets ganked by Talon in the jungle via wall hop.

Does Lux need E to farm? At the same time, if Talon hasn't clear his farm, he can Q back to his farm or he either bait your E out of you.

If he runs into the jungler, it is probably unlucky or Talon messed up in some way.
If he gets to bot lane, it would be a 3v2, and it would likely be a win on his side unless Talon or his bot lane really fucks up(or the enemy bot lane had the lvl and gold advantage). He isn't going there to 1v2 or 2v2(most likely). 
If you add junglers, there is 4v3 unless one isn't paying attention.

Talon is just an inherently difficult champion to balance, he outputs SO MUCH damage while being super squishy at the same time so if you nerf his damage he becomes almost unplayable. I do think his crit Q NEEDS to be reduced. It's so punishing if you can get close to your enemy but if you can't you're kind of useless. Maybe 133% instead of 150%.

I think his E mobility needs to be reduced, if you manage to dodge his abilities and catch him he can just leap over walls which don't have that much of a cooldown (and there's a ton of them he can jump over).

There should be a higher cooldown on the ACTUAL ability. Like 20/16/12/8/4 seconds, so if you catch him out he can't necessarily escape and he has to choose if he will use his E to engage or not. (late game this won't be an issue since it's only 4 seconds).
